summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 13, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and facility checks across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The logs note an inmate on psychological observation with a companion and record the arrival of a new inmate committed by the FBI in the evening.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the shift operations, conducting counts, and logging events. Mentioned generically across all shifts.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Relieving officer mentioned during shift changes.

events.title: FBI New Commit
events.description: The FBI brought in one new inmate to the facility during the Evening Watch shift.

events.title: Inmate on Psychological Observation
events.description: An inmate was noted as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion across all three shifts.

events.title: Daily Facility Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine operations including multiple institutional counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, and inmate movements (court returns, new commits, transfers).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log documents the date August 13, 2019, which is significant as it is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and during his incarceration.
An inmate was on psychological observation with an inmate companion, a detail noted as sensitive information across all shifts.
The FBI brought in one new inmate commit during the Evening Watch shift.
The facility conducted regular counts, with the inmate population fluctuating due to court movements, new commits, and transfers.
The log indicates operational issues, including a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements.
